pr_title: PLANNER-1998: [Tasks Assignment] Test fixes, windows directory and ibm key store

timeline.message:
PLANNER-1998: [Tasks Assignment] Test fixes, windows directory and ibm key store

    - Fix SimpleUserSystemService windows directoy error
    - Adds the IBM jdk generated KeyStore taskAssigningKeystoreIBM.jceks for the TaskAssigning tests

timeline.bodyText: Great idea with using a second keystore that is compatible with the IBM java, thanks!
timeline.author: rsynek

timeline.bodyText: IDE suggests this is a dead code. As such, it may easily disappear in any refactoring to come. Do we need to keep the code, in other words, do we expect the keystore to change in the future? If so, how about moving the keystore creation into a separate class with a main method (still under the test directory structure)?
timeline.author: rsynek

replies.bodyText: I think it makes sense to keep it, it took time to investigate and do reverse engineering to understand how the original jBPM key store was created. If there are any "future" format issues we'll need this class for regenerate the keystore and test, etc.
replies.author: wmedvede

timeline.bodyText: Suggestion: instead of synchronizing access to this variable, can we use the AtomicInteger?
timeline.author: rsynek
